TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Deibert sandy loam - on a 13 percent slopes on a kame moraine in a forested area.  (Colors are for moist soil unless otherwise stated)
A--0 to 4 inches; very dark gray (10YR 3/1) sandy loam; gray (10YR 6/1) dry; weak medium granular structure; friable; many fine, common medium and few coarse roots; about 1 percent fine gravel; slightly acid; abrupt wavy boundary.  (1 to 5 inches thick)
E--4 to 8 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) sandy loam; light gray (10YR 7/1) dry; weak medium granular structure; friable; common fine, medium and few coarse roots; about 3 percent fine gravel; slightly acid; clear irregular boundary.  (2 to 5 inches thick)
B\E--8 to 15 inches; reddish brown (5YR 4/3) silty clay loam (Bt); moderate medium subangular blocky structure; firm; common fine and few medium and coarse roots; common distinct dark brown (10YR 3/3) clay skins on faces of peds; occupies about 70 percent of the horizon completely surrounded by or penetrated by tongues of brown (10YR 5/3) sandy loam (E); light gray (10YR 7/1) dry; weak medium granular structure; about 3 percent fine gravel; neutral; clear irregular boundary.  (3 to 8 inches thick)
Bt--15 to 26 inches; reddish brown (5YR 4/3) silty clay loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; firm; common fine and medium roots; common distinct dark brown (10YR 3/3) clay skins on faces of peds; about 3 percent fine gravel; neutral; clear wavy boundary.  (8 to 17 inches thick)
C--26 to 37 inches; brown (7.5YR 5/4) silty clay loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; firm; about 1 percent fine gravel; strong effervescence; moderately alkaline; abrupt wavy boundary.  (0 to 14 inches thick)
2E' and Bt--37 to 68 inches; yellowish brown (10YR 5/3) sand (E); single grain; loose; lamellae and bands of dark brown (7.5YR 4/4) loamy sand (Bt); weak medium granular structure; very friable; clay bridging between sand grains; few roots; slightly acid; abrupt wavy boundary.  (12 to 31 inches thick)
3C--68 to 80 inches; light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) stratified sand and gravel; single grain; loose; about 16 percent fine gravel, 5 percent medium gravel, and 3 percent coarse gravel; strong effervescence, moderately alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Kalkaska County, Michigan; 200 feet east and 150 feet south of the northwest corner of sec. 26, T. 25 N., R. 8 W., USGS topographic quadrangle Fife Lake; Lat. 44 degrees 32 minutes 53 seconds N. and long. 85 degrees 14 minutes 48 seconds W.; Springfield Township.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: The depth to the base of the argillic horizon is 20 to 45 inches.  Clay content of the argillic horizon averages 20 to 35 percent.  Gravel content ranges from 1 to 10 percent in the loamy material and 3 to 27 percent in the sandy substratum.  Cobble content ranges from 0 to 3 percent throughout the profile.
The upper part of the control section (A horizon) has hue of 10YR, value of 2 or 3, and chroma of 1 or 2.  It is dominantly sandy loam but range includes fine sandy loam or loam.  Reaction of the A horizon ranges from moderately acid to slightly acid.
The second part of the control section (E horizon) has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 4 to 6, and chroma of 2 or 3.  It is sandy loam or fine sandy loam.  The E horizon can have fragipan like characteristics of being hard and brittle when dry.  Reaction of the E horizon ranges from slightly acid to neutral.
The third part of the control section (B\E, Bt horizons) has hue of 7.5 YR or 5YR, value and chroma of 3 or 4.  It is silty clay loam or clay loam.  The E part has colors and textures similar to the E horizon.  Reaction of the B\E horizon ranges from slightly acid to slightly alkaline.
The fourth part of the control section (C horizon) has hue of 7.5YR, and 10YR, value of 4 to 6, and chroma of 3 to 6.  It is silty clay loam, clay loam or silt loam.  Reaction of the C horizon ranges from slightly alkaline to moderately alkaline.
The fifth part of the control section (2E' and Bt horizons) has hue of 10YR, value of 5 or 6 and chroma of 2 to 4.  It is sand.  The Bt part of the 2E' and Bt horizon occurs as lamellae 1/4 to 3 inches thick.  It has hue of 5YR, or 7.5YR, value of 3 to 5 and chroma of 3 to 6.  It is loamy sand or sandy loam.
The lower part of the control section (3C horizon) has hue of 10YR, value of 4 to 7 and chroma of 3 to 6.  It is stratified sand and gravel or gravelly sand.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES: There are no other series in the same family.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING: Deibert soils are on kame moraines, kames and end moraines.  Slope gradient ranges from 12 to 35 percent.  Mean annual precipitation ranges from 27 to 32 inches, the mean annual temperature ranges from 43 to 47 degrees F., frost free days range from 90 to 120 days, and elevation ranges from 1000 to 1200 feet above sea level.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS: These soils are the well drained Menominee and Blue Lake soils, and the somewhat excessively drained Islandlake soils.  They occur on similar landscape positions.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained.  Surface runoff is rapid to very rapid depending on slope.  Permeability is slow over rapid.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION: A large part is in woodland.  Forest vegetation consist chiefly of sugar maple, american beech, black cherry, american basswood, and white ash.  Few areas are in pasture.  Small areas of christmas trees plantations are also present.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Northern lower peninsula of Michigan.  The series is of small extent in MLRA 94A.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: AMHERST, MASSACHUSETTS

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS: Diagnostic horizons and other features recognized in the pedon are: ochric epipedon - zone from the surface to 4 inches; albic horizon - zone from 4 to 8 inches (E horizon): argillic horizon - zone from 8 to 26 inches (B part of the B\E horizon and Bt horizon); alithologic discontinuity from loamy to sandy material at 37 inches.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
